subject: Medicine
title: The Black Death
description: Learn The Black Death in one minute.

hook.text: Between 1347 and 1353, the Black Death killed one-third of Europe's populationâ€”roughly 25 million people.

buildup.text: The plague bacterium Yersinia pestis traveled along trade routes, carried by fleas on rats.

discovery.text: Victims developed black swellings called buboes. Death often followed within days of symptoms.

twist.text: The labor shortage after the plague gave surviving peasants bargaining powerâ€”accelerating feudalism's end.

climax.text: The Black Death reshaped European society, economy, and culture more than any war or revolution.

punchline.text: A flea-borne bacterium rewrote European history.

quiz.question: What unexpected social effect did the Black Death have?
options: Surviving workers gained bargaining power, weakening feudalism
It strengthened the power of feudal lords
It had no lasting impact on European society
